Line 69: Line 69:
Throughout the 1930s, the Kaimin was formatted in broadsheet, eight-column form. In 1939, the Kaimin changed to a five-column daily paper for two academic quarters. The format change was considered a success and was made permanent.
Throughout the 1930s, the Kaimin was formatted in broadsheet, eight-column form. In 1939, the Kaimin changed to a five-column daily paper for two academic quarters. The format change was considered a success and was made permanent.

== Web Presence ==
== Web Presence ==
1994 marked the first time the paper was available to the world over the Internet, known as ''Kaimin On Line''. Since then, the online website is referred to as just the Montana Kaimin. Starting in Fall 2010, online video installments have been added weekly. These "webisodes" include ''AJ Versus'' which a staff member faces an University of Montana athlete in different challenges and ''Live at the Kaimin'' which is a live musical performance in the Kaimin offices.<ref>http://www.montanakaimin.com</ref>
